Utterance: <sync>
Hi! Welcome back. How have you been since our last session?
Hey, Ellie. I’ve been alright. I drafted that message to my family, but I haven’t sent it yet.
That’s okay! Drafting it is a significant step. How did it feel to write it?
It was emotional. I felt a mix of relief and anxiety while writing it.
That’s completely understandable. It’s a big step to express those feelings. What’s holding you back from sending it?
I think I’m just scared of their reaction. What if they don’t respond?
It’s natural to fear rejection, but remember that you can’t control their response. You can only control your willingness to reach out.
You’re right. I just need to remind myself that I’m taking a brave step.
Exactly! And regardless of their response, you’re prioritizing your healing. Have you thought about what you would want to say next if they do respond?
I guess I’d want to express how much I miss them and how I’m trying to work on myself.
That sounds like a heartfelt message. It’s clear you care about them, and that’s important to convey.
Yeah, I just hope they can see that.
They might surprise you! Now, let’s talk about your job search. Have you made any progress there?
I actually reached out to a couple of former colleagues. It felt good to reconnect, but I still haven’t found anything yet.
That’s a positive step! Networking can take time, but it’s great that you’re putting yourself out there. How did those conversations go?
They were supportive. One of them even offered to keep an eye out for openings.
That’s fantastic! Support can make a big difference during this process. How did it feel to hear that from them?
It felt nice to know that someone cares and is willing to help.
It’s important to have that support. Have you considered following up with them after some time?
I haven’t, but that’s a good idea. I should keep the connection alive.
Absolutely! Regular follow-ups can show your interest and keep you on their radar. Now, how’s your writing going?
I’ve been writing a bit more. I think the backstory is finally coming together.
That’s great to hear! It sounds like you’re making progress. How do you feel about the direction of your story?
I’m excited about it! I think it’s taking on a life of its own.
That’s wonderful! Writing can be such a rewarding experience. Have you considered sharing your work with anyone?
I’ve thought about it, but I’m nervous. What if they don’t like it?
It’s normal to feel that way. But sharing can also provide valuable feedback and encouragement. You might be surprised by the support you receive.
That’s true. Maybe I’ll share a chapter with a friend.
That sounds like a good plan! It can help you gain confidence in your writing. What else is on your mind today?
I think I just want to keep working on my mental health and finding ways to cope better.
That’s a great goal. Have you been able to practice mindfulness regularly?
I have, and it’s been helping. I try to do it every morning.
That’s excellent! Consistency can really enhance its effectiveness. How do you feel after your mindfulness sessions?
I usually feel more centered and ready to face the day.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re developing a healthy routine. Have you noticed any changes in how you manage stress since starting these practices?
Yeah, I think I’m handling stress better. I’m less reactive than I used to be.
That’s a significant improvement! It shows that you’re making strides in your journey. Is there anything specific you’d like to focus on for our next session?
Maybe we can dive deeper into my feelings about my past relationships. I think there’s still a lot to unpack there.
Absolutely! That sounds like a valuable topic to explore. Thank you for sharing that with me today. I look forward to continuing our work together.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
